title: (x) Rainmaker Management Group logo - Gradl {Mike Y}
content:
I am looking for the font that the “rainmaker” portion of this logo is in. I have searched for days, so thank you very much in advance for any help.

author: pheinixx

comments.content:
This is ’Gradl’ a Microsoft TrueType font that was done by Font Bureau in the mid-90’s. Based on an all-caps Art Nouveau design by M. J. Gradl.

- Mike Yanega
Nice, Mike. Where did you gather that info? Perhaps [Maigret](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000157/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=C.100868.0.0) is that Gradl design?
Hmm. Sample text seems to be broken for that font, Stephen.
Are you trying to set lowercase? It’s an all caps font with an alternate ’S’ in the lc slot.
[ITC Stoclet](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000157/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=stoclet) is a simplified face in this vein.

Stephen,

I have the Microsoft True Type Mac collection that included it. The booklet gives fairly good details about the origin. The lower case was designed to complement the original typeface which was apparently only upper case.

There are a number of adaptations of the Gradl design (shown in the Dover book by Ludwig Petzendorfer): Swaak Centennial (Mecanorma), Maigret (Panache); Reynolds Caps (Intecsas/Rakowski), Santini (Canada Type); Sarah Caps (Sam Wang); and Pigalle (Solotype Catalog)

- Mike Yanega
Thank you very much, I will hunt this down.
[Here is a list](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830000157/http:/www.microsoft.com/typography/fonts/font.aspx?FID=104&FNAME=Gradl&FVER=1.50) of the Microsoft products that Gradl was bundled with.
